result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
State's Motion for Joinder, filed.

Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court (via zoom) with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask (in person).  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Defense advise defendant unable to appear in person due to covid positive. State requesting stayed bench warrant and additional medical documentation. Court adjourns jury trial and orders additional medical documentation regarding positive covid test. Court orders state to file joinder/other acts motion. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Received & Filed, PRELIMINARY HEARING of Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing 03-09-2022 by KAREN M. PALIS.

Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deautris Q Mattison appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20CF4167 & 15CF3767. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Casey. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.
